result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

FOP Order staying proceedings
FOP Acceptance
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[ma] Case called at 3:09pm 
Defendant Tarina L Caughlin in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon inquiry of the Court, Ms. Cauglin indicates that she still needs to complete and submit FOP paperwork; additionally waiting on funds from bond. 

ADA Teuber warns Ms. Caughlin that opportunity to participate in FOP may be ending. 
recess: 3:13pm
NEXT: Status on 5/5/22 at 8:15am
Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:25am 
Defendant Tarina L Caughlin in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
ADA Beck reports that Ms. Caughlin had an appointment with the First Offender Program staffperson on April 12th.  Her office is awaiting the signed FOP contract.  The parties are also circulating a written stipulation that would need the bond surety's signature; this stipulation would call for a portion of the posted cash bond funds to be paid over for application to pay the FOP program fee.
recess 10:28am  

NEXT:  Status Conference on April 29th at 3:00pm [this hearing will be removed from the Court's calendar if verification of FOP admission is received before the hearing date]
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:30 AM.   Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Tarina L Caughlin in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights complaince verified. 
Defendant indicates that she is not trying to get an attorney. 
ADA Shock indicates that there was not an agreement reached at PTC. 
Defendant states that she had called the DA's Office twice since the PTC leaving messages that she has changed her mind and is willing to do FOP. 
Scheduling addressed by the Court and parties. 
Defendant will schedule an FOP appointment before leaving the building today. 
Case continued for STC on 4/19/22 at 10am. 
Recess 9:34am

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
STC on 4/19/22 at 10am.
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on March 9, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on March 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

**Already Posted**
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--cooperate with Jefferson County Human Services 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 08:39 AM Defendant Tarina L Caughlin in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $650 CASH Bond [already posted], with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--cooperate with Jefferson County Human Services 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

The Court quashes warrant
recess 8:46 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/9/22 at 10:40 am   (2) Status Conference on 3/28/22 at 9:30 am

I left the 2/14/22 Initial Appearance date on the calendar since a summons was sent; the Defendant failed to appear at date on bond; case was set for IA because bond was received after complaint was filed//ma

[ma] Case called at 1:31pm [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Tarina L Caughlin does NOT appear. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Upon review of the bond, the Court determines that Ms. Cauglin was on notice of todays hearing.

Per request of Attorney Flint, the Court authorizes a body only warrant. 

recess 1:33 pm.
